message_1:
In a survey conducted among 100 students, the following scores were obtained in Maths and Science:

|Student | Maths Score | Science Score |
|---|---|---|
|1|65|92|
|2|54|86|
|3|72|95|
|4|68|87|
|5|75|90|
|6|50|78|
|7|63|85|
|8|58|80|
|9|80|96|
|10|69|91|

Using cluster analysis, group the students based on their Maths and Science scores, with a maximum of 3 clusters.
message_2:
To perform cluster analysis, we can use the k-means clustering algorithm. Since we want a maximum of 3 clusters, we will set k=3. The algorithm works as follows:

1. Initialize the centroids randomly by selecting k data points.
2. Assign each data point to the nearest centroid.
3. Update the centroids by calculating the mean of all the data points assigned to each centroid.
4. Repeat steps 2 and 3 until the centroids do not change significantly or a certain number of iterations have been reached.

Applying the k-means clustering algorithm to the given data:

Initial Centroids (randomly selected):
C1: (65, 92)
C2: (54, 86)
C3: (72, 95)

After the first iteration:
C1: (67, 91.5)
C2: (54, 82)
C3: (75.6667, 93.6667)

After the second iteration:
C1: (66, 90)
C2: (54, 82)
C3: (75.6667, 93.6667)

The centroids do not change significantly after the second iteration, so we can stop here.

Assigning the students to the nearest centroid, we get the following clusters:

Cluster 1 (C1: (66, 90)):
- Student 1: (65, 92)
- Student 4: (68, 87)
- Student 7: (63, 85)
- Student 10: (69, 91)

Cluster 2 (C2: (54, 82)):
- Student 2: (54, 86)
- Student 6: (50, 78)
- Student 8: (58, 80)

Cluster 3 (C3: (75.6667, 93.6667)):
- Student 3: (72, 95)
- Student 5: (75, 90)
- Student 9: (80, 96)

So, the students are grouped into 3 clusters based on their Maths and Science scores.
